page.title: 18POLITICS IN HEADCORN
page.content: The S.E. part of the area is the most densely poulated and lies entirely within the Parish of Headcorn. 13 members are elected to the{Parish {Council}to serve for 4 years. These elections are carried out on a semi perty political basis. The whole area lies within the{Borough of Maidstone and so elects Borough Councillors. At present Headcorn Ward returns 1 Liberal and 1 Conservative member. Staplehurst Ward in which the S.W. part lies returns 2 Coservative members and the N. part (Sutton Valence Ward) returns 1 Conservative. The{Kent County Councillor}for the area lives in Headcorn (Mr.S.Burden Cons.). The local{M.P.}is Sir John Wells (Cons.). Our{M.E.P.}Mr.Jackson is also Conservative. The{trend}over the last few years seems to have been for an upsurge of Liberal activity.
